* Initializes a new Deadline task with the given description and deadline date.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by          The deadline date in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm".
System.out.println("Date given is in an invalid format.");
* Returns a formatted string representation of the Deadline task, including its type, description, and deadline.
* @return A formatted string representing the Deadline task.
return "[D]" + super.toString() + " (by: " + this.by.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMM yyyy h:mm a")) + ")";

* @return A string representing the Deadline task in a file format.

invalid, todo, deadline, event, mark, unmark, list, delete, bye;

* Manages the loading and saving of tasks from/to a file.
* Initializes a storage manager with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks will be stored.
* Loads tasks from the file and returns them as a list.
* @return A list of tasks loaded from the file.
Event event = new Event(description, from, to);
* Saves tasks from a task list to the file.
* @param taskList The task list containing tasks to be saved.

* Marks a task as not done in the task list at the specified index.

* @return The number of tasks in the task list.

* @return The user's input as a string.
* Displays a welcome message when the application starts.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays a goodbye message when the user exits the application.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays a message when a file is successfully created.
* Displays a message when a saved file is opened.

System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message when a task is marked as not done.
* @param task The task that was marked as not done.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a message when a task is added to the task list.

public void addTaskMessage(Task task, int numOfTasks) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + numOfTasks + " tasks in the list.");
